New Records: Toronto batters turned 23 hits into 15 runs, both season highs for the team.
Key Match Events: Zebby Matthews gave up nine runs off 10 hits in an outing that lasted just two innings.
Daulton Varsho hit a 419-foot homer to put Toronto up 2-0.
Spencer Horwitz hit a 381-foot shot to right field making it 4-0.
Leo Jimenez hit a two-run single to make it 7-0.
Addison Barger hit a 395-foot two-run shot in the second inning extending the Blue Jays' advantage to 9-0.
Jose Berrios kept the Twins to just three hits and no runs through six innings.
Kyle Farmer pitched a pair of innings, giving up four runs in the eighth and ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Zebby Matthews expressed frustration over his performance and emphasized getting back to work.
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli commented on Matthews' performance, stating that dealing with such games is part of the process.
Baldelli praised Kyle Farmer for pitching a pair of innings and providing relief to the bullpen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins remain within 3.5 games of the Guardians for the AL Central lead and 2.5 games back of the Royals in the division standings.
The Twins still have a chance to win their three-game series against the Blue Jays with the series finale on Sunday.
